intro: Microsteira axillaris var. perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's microsteira, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
